title: HTML Introduction
description:
HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is the standard markup language for creating web pages. It describes the structure of a web page using markup.

HTML elements are the building blocks of HTML pages. Elements are represented by tags.
example:
My First Heading

My first paragraph.

title: HTML Elements
description:
HTML elements are everything from the start tag to the end tag. HTML elements can have attributes that provide additional information about the element.

Some common elements include headings, paragraphs, links, and images.
example:
This is a heading

This is a paragraph.

This is a link

title: HTML Forms
description:
HTML forms are used to collect user input. Forms contain special elements called controls like input fields, checkboxes, radio buttons, submit buttons, etc.

The

element defines an HTML form. Form elements are different types of input elements, checkboxes, radio buttons, submit buttons, and more.

title: Semantic HTML
description:
Semantic HTML elements clearly describe their meaning to both the browser and the developer. Examples include

,

, etc.

Using semantic elements provides better accessibility, SEO, and makes the code more readable.
example:

  • About

Article content...

title: HTML Multimedia
description:
HTML supports various multimedia resources such as images, audio, and video. The element is used for images,

Always include alt attributes for images for accessibility, and consider multiple source formats for better browser support.
